cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi ESE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest-to-north and track toward the North Carolina coast, then move across eastern NC, southeastern VA and the Delmarva Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central North Carolina coast (around Cape Lookout â€“ Cape Fear)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch Surf City-Duck NC, Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point, tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE; Storm Surge Warning Duck NC to Chincoteague VA, lower Chesapeake Bay, Neuse & Pamlico Rivers
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts from South Carolina northward to southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (25-35 mph) in squalls Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1-2 ft possible around high tide, mainly along open beaches and tidal rivers
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could deliver 1-2 in of rain, locally 3 in, Friday-Friday night
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Georgia and South Carolina beaches; brief marine squalls may disrupt pilotage windows
